title: Strings
subject: Data Structures
theory: Strings are effectively arrays of characters. In languages like Java/Python, strings are immutable (cannot be changed once created). In C++, they are mutable.

common_mistakes.correction: In immutable languages, `s += "a"` creates a NEW string every time. O(n^2). Use StringBuilder.
common_mistakes.example: for i in range(n): s += c // BAD

summary: Text processing relies heavily on string manipulation.
